question_text: A laser emits light of wavelength 633 nm. What is the energy of a single photon emitted? (h = 6.63×10⁻³⁴ Js, c = 3.00×10⁸ m/s)
In a laser medium with 1×10²⁰ atoms, if 7×10¹⁹ atoms are in the excited state, what fraction of atoms contribute to stimulated emission?
A laser outputs 5 mW of light at 650 nm. How many photons are emitted per second?
explanation: Photon energy E = hc/λ; Number/sec = Power/E ≈ (5×10⁻³) ÷ (3.06×10⁻¹⁹) ≈ 1.63×10¹⁶ photons/s.

question_text: A laser requires 50 W of electrical input and produces a 5 W laser beam. What is its efficiency?
A laser beam diverges at 1.5 mrad. What will be its spot diameter after traveling 2 km?
